title: How to Get Rid of a UTI Without Medication

steps.title: Make sure you are hydrated enough so that you can go to the bathroom frequently.
steps.content: Make sure you are hydrated enough so that you can go to the bathroom frequently. Drink lots of water! [1] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Taking loads of antibiotics frequently isn't good for your body.
steps.content: Taking loads of antibiotics frequently isn't good for your body. It may even make future infections resistant to antibiotics and make women more susceptible to yeast infections.

steps.title: 500 mg of Vitamin C can make your urine more acidic which can inhibit bacterial growth.
steps.content: 500 mg of Vitamin C can make your urine more acidic which can inhibit bacterial growth. Adding some Vitamin C to your daily routine can help prevent UTIs from returning. [2] X Trustworthy Source Johns Hopkins Medicine Official resource database of the world-leading Johns Hopkins Hospital Go to source [3] X Expert Source Scott Tobis, MD Board Certified Urologist Expert Interview. 26 August 2021.

steps.title: A big cause of UTIs is e.
steps.content: A big cause of UTIs is e. coli, which can come from your digestive system. Sexual activity, from the constant movement, can push this type of bacteria into the urethra. Always make sure your privates are clean from the front to back. [4] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source Washing the genitals with water (or an intimate cleanser) and washing your behind with warm soap and water in the shower will help immensely. Baby wipes after using the bathroom can be used too.

steps.title: Peeing after sex can flush out any bacteria that may have been pushed into your urethra.
steps.content: Peeing after sex can flush out any bacteria that may have been pushed into your urethra. [5] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source Many people claim this interferes with 'cuddle' time, but you can cuddle after going to the bathroom. This is the single most overlooked and ignored step that prevent UTIs more than anything. Explaining this to your partner can ease any frustration, and they should be able to understand.

steps.title: Neem leaves can help flush your system of bacteria and fungus.
steps.content: Neem leaves can help flush your system of bacteria and fungus. Bring a large pot of water to a boil, and add Neem leaves. This will brew a strong, bitter tea that is naturally anti-bacterial and anti-fungal. [6] X Research source Add D-mannose capsules or powder and drink several glasses throughout the day. You should be urinating quite a lot due to the high fluid intake, and both should flush bacteria out of the bladder and urethra. [7] X Expert Source Scott Tobis, MD Board Certified Urologist Expert Interview. 26 August 2021. Put a few ice cubes in the pot to cool down the tea, since you will want to start drinking it immediately. The neem tea has a very bitter taste, and is highly unpleasant to drink because of its bad taste. If you can, try to drink the rest of your tea in the pot throughout the day. If needed, drink water in between if the taste is too strong. You can't really overdose on d-mannose since it is a naturally derived from cranberries. It is recommended that you take 3-4 capsules every hour or so.

steps.title: If you don't start feeling better within 4 to 6 hours, see your primary physician or OB/GYN as soon as possible.
steps.content: If you don't start feeling better within 4 to 6 hours, see your primary physician or OB/GYN as soon as possible. In serious cases, UTIs can lead to kidney infections, so it is imperative to treat the problem swiftly. [8] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source If all else fails, you can find your nearest Minute Clinic at a local drugstore and they should be able to prescribe you antibiotics. Last resort: go to the hospital if none of these options are available. If you have symptoms of fevers, shaking chills, vomiting, feel faint or very lethargic, seek medical care immediately. [9] X Expert Source Scott Tobis, MD Board Certified Urologist Expert Interview. 26 August 2021.
